Main

Class SpaceInvaders

  • java.lang.Object

  • All Implemented Interfaces:

extends java.awt.Canvas

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SpaceInvaders()
      The constructor for the game is responsible for setting up the frame, adding a new panel to it, and setting up various other boilerplate code for smooth animation.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private GameObject[] addNewShotToArray(GameObject[] originalObjects)
      addNewShotToArray() takes the original array of projectiles, and increases its size by 1, then it adds a new shot at the last element in the new array.
      private boolean checkBoundaries(int xPos, int yPos)
      This method returns true if the passed x,y position exists outside of the frame.
      private void checkForEnemyHits()
      Checks each shot against each enemy to see if there are any intersections, if there is, then remove those objects from the screen.
      private GameObject[] clearObjectArray()
      clearObjectArray() just returns an empty object array.
      private GameObject createNewShot()
      This method creates and returns shots for addNewShotToArray() it also logs the time the shot was created to keep track of time between shots.
      private void drawGame(java.awt.Graphics pen)
      drawGame() is responsible for passing the graphics object to all the necessary drawing methods, as well as drawing various UI elements.
      private void drawGameObjects(java.awt.Graphics pen, GameObject[] gameObjects)
      This is a general purpose method to loop through all of the game object arrays and call each element's draw method.
      private GameObject[] fillEnemyArray()
      This method fills the enemy array with enemies at a position off screen.
      void gameLoop()
      gameLoop() loops through all of the updating and drawing of the game for each frame.
      private int getShotTime()
      Calculates the change in time since the last shot.
      private void moveEnemies()
      This method goes through the entire array and moves each enemy.
      private void playerAction()
      This modifies the game state based on what the keyboard object says the user has entered.
      private GameObject[] removeObject(int index, GameObject[] originalObjects)
      removeObject() is used whenever an item in an array needs to be deleted.
      private void searchForWinner()
      This method checks each frame to see if any of the win/loss conditions have been met.
      private void shootIfAble()
      shootIfAble() checks whenever the spacebar is pressed, if the ship can add another shot to the projectile array.
      private void showScreenMessage(java.lang.String screenMessage, java.awt.Graphics pen, int yPos)
      This method is used for displaying messages to the screen (for starting, and restarting).
      private void sleep()
      This sleeps the loop for SLEEP_TIME to give the illusion of motion.
      private void updateGame()
      updateGame() modifies all of the game data based on the current state of the game.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SpaceInvaders

        public SpaceInvaders()
        The constructor for the game is responsible for setting up the frame, adding a new panel to it, and setting up various other boilerplate code for smooth animation.

    • Method Detail

      • gameLoop

        public void gameLoop()
        gameLoop() loops through all of the updating and drawing of the game for each frame.

      • updateGame

        private void updateGame()
        updateGame() modifies all of the game data based on the current state of the game.

      • playerAction

        private void playerAction()
        This modifies the game state based on what the keyboard object says the user has entered.

      • fillEnemyArray

        private GameObject[] fillEnemyArray()
        This method fills the enemy array with enemies at a position off screen. They move left until they hit the edge, then enter the game screen and continue their behavior.
        Returns:
        Returns a new gameObject array with enemies.

      • moveEnemies

        private void moveEnemies()
        This method goes through the entire array and moves each enemy. It also does the recursive check for each enemy in the game, ensuring that they all start in the same place off screen, but start at different times.

      • searchForWinner

        private void searchForWinner()
        This method checks each frame to see if any of the win/loss conditions have been met.

      • drawGame

        private void drawGame(java.awt.Graphics pen)
        drawGame() is responsible for passing the graphics object to all the necessary drawing methods, as well as drawing various UI elements.
        Parameters:
        pen - The graphics object to which is drawn

      • drawGameObjects

        private void drawGameObjects(java.awt.Graphics pen,
                             GameObject[] gameObjects)
        This is a general purpose method to loop through all of the game object arrays and call each element's draw method.
        Parameters:
        pen - What is being drawn to.
        gameObjects - The array of passed GameObjects

      • shootIfAble

        private void shootIfAble()
        shootIfAble() checks whenever the spacebar is pressed, if the ship can add another shot to the projectile array. Ability to shoot is determined by the time between shots and if the shot is the first shot or not.

      • addNewShotToArray

        private GameObject[] addNewShotToArray(GameObject[] originalObjects)
        addNewShotToArray() takes the original array of projectiles, and increases its size by 1, then it adds a new shot at the last element in the new array. Each element from the old array is copied over to the new one.
        Parameters:
        originalObjects - The original array of shots.
        Returns:
        The array of shots + one more.

      • createNewShot

        private GameObject createNewShot()
        This method creates and returns shots for addNewShotToArray() it also logs the time the shot was created to keep track of time between shots.
        Returns:
        Returns a new projectile object.

      • clearObjectArray

        private GameObject[] clearObjectArray()
        clearObjectArray() just returns an empty object array.
        Returns:
        Returns a new empty array

      • removeObject

        private GameObject[] removeObject(int index,
                                  GameObject[] originalObjects)
        removeObject() is used whenever an item in an array needs to be deleted. It creates an array of size - 1, then copies over every element except for the index into the new array.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the item to be deleted.
        originalObjects - The array of original objects.
        Returns:
        A new array of objects.

      • getShotTime

        private int getShotTime()
        Calculates the change in time since the last shot.
        Returns:
        The amount of time since the last shot.

      • checkForEnemyHits

        private void checkForEnemyHits()
        Checks each shot against each enemy to see if there are any intersections, if there is, then remove those objects from the screen.

      • checkBoundaries

        private boolean checkBoundaries(int xPos,
                                int yPos)
        This method returns true if the passed x,y position exists outside of the frame. It is used to delete shots as they leave the frame.
        Parameters:
        xPos - The x position to check
        yPos - The y position to check
        Returns:
        Whether or not the point is outside.

      • showScreenMessage

        private void showScreenMessage(java.lang.String screenMessage,
                               java.awt.Graphics pen,
                               int yPos)
        This method is used for displaying messages to the screen (for starting, and restarting).
        Parameters:
        screenMessage - Message to be shown
        pen - Graphics object to which is drawn
        yPos - The y postion where the message is placed.

      • sleep

        private void sleep()
        This sleeps the loop for SLEEP_TIME to give the illusion of motion.
